thread.title: For Black History Month, these cute black kids take Trump's 'alternate facts' to task
thread.title_full: For Black History Month, these cute black kids take Trump's 'alternate facts' to task | Mic

author: mic.com
title: For Black History Month, these cute black kids take Trump's 'alternate facts' to task

organizations.name: youtube this is the first black history month

text:
President Donald Trump and his administration may be pushing the idea of " alternative facts " to the American public, but at least these kids aren't buying it.
In a video by Eunique Jones, creator of a public awareness campaign called " Because of Them, We Can ," these adorable little ones are challenging what we learn about black history in the United States. Like many, they're pushing back on the term "alternative facts."
Because of Them, We Can Source: Because of Them, We Can Here are a few things they know are real: black boy joy, black girl magic, black wealth, black support, black excellence and of course, black lives.
"Black history didn't start with slavery," they say. "And it doesn't end with the Obamas, whom we love and miss. No like, really, we really miss you."
Source: YouTube This is the first Black History Month after Barack Obama 's presidency. On Wednesday, Trump welcomed several black leaders to a roundtable meeting to celebrate the month and is expected to unveil a "forever" stamp for civil rights leader Dorothy Height.
But with 28 days to the month, many people on Twitter began to guess how it would unravel in a Trump White House.
Looking forward to Trump's memo about Black History Month that never mentions black people.
Me waiting on Trump to make any statements in regards to Black History Month: https://t.co/bvh4bCIdJl
The White House thinks inviting Charles Barkley, Steve Harvey, and Stacey Dash will make quite the Black History Month celebration. https://t.co/TJFH2wYpC3
February may be the shortest month of the year, but this looks like it might feel a little bit longer.
